description.narrative:
Partech Africa Fund (Partech Africa or the Fund) is a EUR
100 million early-stage VC fund focused on businesses in the technology sector in SSA, or non-African companies whose primary business operations are based in Africa. The investment allocation will be split among Seed round, Series A and Series B rounds, with remaining capital reserved for follow-on rounds in top portfolio companies.

i. Access to capital: Access to equity is difficult for asset light businesses such as technology firms. The Fund will help support the innovation, technology, and entrepreneurs in SSA. The IFC commitment will help improve access to the much needed long-term equity capital for emerging early-stage companies in SSA, where the startup funding space is still quite nascent compared with other emerging markets. ii. Job creation and economic growth: Based on IFC's experience, venture capital funds contribute meaningfully to job creation and economic growth. iii. Governance, operational and E&S improvements: IFC will guide and ensure that local businesses implement best practices in various fields

mailing-address.narrative: Partech Partners General Partners General Partners +33 1 53 65 65 53 contact@partechventures.com 18, Avenue de Messine, 75008 Paris, France www.partechventures.com

name.narrative: The Fund will be based in both Dakar, Senegal and Paris, France. The Fund commits to make a minimum of 60% of investments in the following core countries: Nigeria, Kenya, Senegal, Côte dIvoire, Cameroon, Ghana, Tanzania and Uganda, and up to 40% in the rest of Africa. The Fund is structured as a French Special Limited Partnership.
